physical_appearance: This is a coloured print that features a drawing of a dimly-lit room filled with people lying on plants. Candles and laterns are seen hanging from the ceiling.
sgcool_label_text: This is a print from Hugo V Pedersen's book, Door den Oost-Indischen Archipel, which charted his travels in the East Indian Archipelago. The print was based on an actual sketch of a Chinese opium den in Singapore, which is presented as a dark, mystical place. Pedersen was a Danish artist who travelled to the Far East, including Singapore, in 1895.
title_text: Print from Hugo V Pedersen's Door den Oost-Indischen Archipel of a Chinese opium den in Singapore
subject_terms_2: Lithography Orientalism  Opium abuse Exoticism in art  Singapore  Drawing  Colour prints
